sentences.sContent: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfil their promises.
sentences.sCn: 矿工们已愤愤地抱怨政府没有兑现他们的承诺。

sentences.sContent: The couple complained about the high cost of visiting Europe.
sentences.sCn: 这对夫妇抱怨了游览欧洲的高昂花费。

sentences.sContent: I shouldn't complain, I've got a good job to go back to.
sentences.sCn: 我不该抱怨，我已有可回去干的一份好工作。

sentences.sContent: "I wish someone would do something about it," he complained.
sentences.sCn: “我希望有人能对此做点什么，”他抱怨道。

sentences.sContent: ...complain less and are closer to family members...
...while pessimists complain that we will experience the greatest unemployment crisis in human history...
...But US researchers quietly complain about budget restraints and having far fewer icebreakers the Russia...
...American scientists complain about lack of sufficient money and equipment for their expansion in Antarctica...
...There’s a lot for students to complain about the repayment threshold for paying back loans will be frozen for five years...
...More and more people complain that they are lost in the information age...
...but he urged me not to complain too loudly...
...What do some people who write to the man complain about...

remMethod.val: com ＋ plain(平常的) → 不要抱怨生活的平淡 → 抱怨， 诉苦

words.tran: 抱怨地；发牢骚地；诉苦地
[法] 原告；发牢骚的人；抱怨者

trans.tranCn: 抱怨， 诉苦； 控告， 投诉
trans.tranOther: If you complain about a situation, you say that you are not satisfied with it
